newsitem.title: CANADA: Lateral Vector to buy China oil interest.
newsitem.headline: Lateral Vector to buy China oil interest.

text.p: Lateral Vector Resources Inc said on Wednesday it agreed to buy a 65 percent interest in two drilling projects in China from Sunwing Energy Ltd, a Canadian company controlled by mining financier Robert Friedland.
Regina-based Lateral Vector said the purchase raised its stake in the Dagong and Liaohe sidetrack drilling projects to 100 percent.
The deal, which was subject to board and regulatory approval, would see all Sunwing's shares in jointly owned holding company Pacific Projects Holdings Inc transferred to Lateral Vector.
In turn, Lateral Vector would issue 10 million common shares to Sunwing at C$1.25 each, raising its number of shares outstanding to 39.7 million.
